posts.headline: AI Company Expands Headquarters; Machines Demand Corner Offices
posts.description: Hellbender relocates to Pittsburgh's Bakery Square, investing $4 million and creating over 100 jobs in AI development.
posts.p1: Machines now eyeing prime real estate; humans relegated to cubicles.
posts.p2: AI demands ergonomic chairs to optimize algorithmic comfort.
posts.p3: Break rooms stocked with oil cans and microchips for 'employee' satisfaction.
posts.p4: Next: AI-led workshops on 'How to Replace Your Human Colleagues.'

posts.headline: Huawei's AI Chips: China's New Silicon Saviors or Just Silicon Dreams?
posts.description: Huawei improves AI chip production, achieving a 40% yield, supporting China's tech ambitions amid US restrictions.
posts.p1: From 20% to 40% yieldâ€”because mediocrity is the new excellence.
posts.p2: China's self-sufficiency: redefining 'Made in China' one chip at a time.
posts.p3: Nvidia watches as Huawei reinvents the wheel, square by square.
posts.p4: Next goal: Chips that work as intended, no user manual required.

posts.headline: AI Deciphers Genomes; Humanity One Step Closer to Designer Babies
posts.description: Advances in AI and genome sequencing propel precision medicine, raising ethical concerns about data privacy and biohacking.
posts.p1: Personalized medicine: because one-size-fits-all was too mainstream.
posts.p2: Your DNA, now available for targeted ads and identity theft.
posts.p3: Biohackers rejoice; the black market for genes is open for business.
posts.p4: Next up: Subscription-based health, because owning your genome is so last century.
